page.title: 09INTERVIEW-SUPERINTENDANT
page.content: Superintendant Embley belongs to Whitley Bay police station.His job is like a manager's and the men under him patrol our surveyed area. A policeman in 1985 has to be aware of the policing needs in his area.In effect he is just a servant to the people of Whitley Bay as the police force are much more accountable to the public nowadays. The Superintendant's job is different to the job of policemen on the beat.He works from 8:30am to 5:30pm at his desk,tied up with paperwork.He is also on call 24 hours a day. Policing has changed over the years due the readily available technology eg computers.Cars and more sophisticated vehicles make the policeman of today more mobile.Radios are an essential part of the policeman's uniform.
